text:
Scientists trying to understand the
hunting secrets of the venus fly trap

found that it takes not one but two
touches to its little hair like sensors

to cause it strapped to snap shut. At
this stage the insect struggles to break

free and digestive enzymes are released.
Later touches discharge chemicals that

help nutrient absorption. This counting
system helps the venus fly trap

distinguish between a real meal and a
false alarm

helping it to save energy for when it is
needed the most.
